Functions

allowIf

  • allowIf(func: any): (Anonymous function)

  • Creates a function that checks whether input meets condition.

    If condition is not met returns undefned.

    Used when supported value needs further processing, and unsupported cancels mapping.

    const f = allowIf(x => x === '42')
f(42) // 42
f(24) // undefined

    Parameters

    • func: any

    Returns (Anonymous function)

applySynonyms

  • applySynonyms(text: string): string

  • Returns a string of encapsulated synonyms for craigslist search.

    This function treats input as string containing words.

    If synonyms for specified input were not found, returns input.

    applySynonyms('xtype') // '((x type)|(x-type)|(xtype))'
applySynonyms('xtype plugin') // '((x type)|(x-type)|(xtype)) ((plug in)|(plug-in)|(plugin))'
applySynonyms('foobar') // 'foobar'
applySynonyms('xtype foobar') // '((x type)|(x-type)|(xtype)) foobar'

    Parameters

    • text: string

    Returns string

Const complementYearRange

  • complementYearRange(year: object): object

  • Complements year range.

    Replaces missing min and max values with 1900 and current year + 2, accordingly.

    If value is present, it won't be replaced.

    complementYearRange({ min: 1990, max: 2010 }) // { min: 1990, max: 2010 }
complementYearRange({ max: 2010 }) // { min: 1900, max: 2010 }
complementYearRange({ min: 1990 }) // { min: 1990, max: 2020 } // assuming we're in 2018

    Parameters

    • year: object

    Returns object

Const formatDate

  • formatDate(format: string): (Anonymous function)

  • Creates a function that formats date.

    const f = formatDate('MM/DD/YYYY')
f('2018-06-20') // '06/20/2018'

    Parameters

    • format: string

    Returns (Anonymous function)

fuzzyIncludes

  • fuzzyIncludes(keyword: string, text: string): boolean

  • Checks whether words from search string are present in text string.

    Text must include all of the words from string, and they should be surrounded by whitespace.

    This function is not case sensetive.

    fuzzyIncludes('IPhone 8 PLUS', 'iPhone 8 Plus') // true
fuzzyIncludes('surfbord', 'surf bord') // true
fuzzyIncludes('iPhone 5S', 'iPhone 5') // false

    Parameters

    • keyword: string
    • text: string

    Returns boolean

getSynonymsArray

  • getSynonymsArray(text: string): string[]

  • Returns an array of synonyms.

    This function treats input as single word.

    If synonyms for specified input were not found, returns input string in array.

    getSynonymsArray('xtype') // ['x type', 'x-type', 'xtype']
getSynonymsArray('xtype plugin') // ['xtype plugin']
getSynonymsArray('foobar') // ['foobar']

    Parameters

    • text: string

    Returns string[]

getSynonymsVariants

  • getSynonymsVariants(text: string): string[]

  • Returns an array of variants of synonyms combinations.

    This function treats input as string containing words.

    If synonyms for specified input were not found, returns input string in array.

    getSynonymsVariants('xtype') // ['x type', 'x-type', 'xtype']
getSynonymsVariants('xtype plugin') // ['x type plug in', 'x type plug-in', 'x type plugin', 'x-type plug in', 'x-type plug-in', 'x-type plugin', 'xtype plug in', 'xtype plug-in', 'xtype plugin']
getSynonymsVariants('foobar') // ['foobar']
getSynonymsVariants('xtype foobar') // ['x type foobar', 'x-type foobar', 'xtype foobar']

    Parameters

    • text: string

    Returns string[]

Const isCanadaProvince

  • isCanadaProvince(x: string): boolean

  • Checks whether input is 2-letter code of Canada province.

    isCanadaProvince('QC') // true

    Parameters

    • x: string

    Returns boolean

pipe

  • pipe(...funcArray: any[]): (Anonymous function)

  • Creates a function that performs left-to-right function composition.

    Result of each function is passed to the next function.

    If undefined is returned by function inside, returns undefined.

    const foo = (...values) => values.join(' ')
pipe(foo)('foo', 'bar', 'baz') // 'foo bar baz'

pipe((x, y) => `${x}${y.bar}`)('foo', { bar: 'bar' }) // 'foobar'

pipe((x, { bar }) => `${x}${bar}`)('foo', { bar: 'bar' }) // 'foobar'

    Parameters

    • Rest ...funcArray: any[]

    Returns (Anonymous function)

Const randomDesktopUserAgent

  • randomDesktopUserAgent(): any

  • Returns random desktop user agent from the list.

    randomDesktopUserAgent() // 'Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.11; rv:48.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/48.0'

    Returns any

Const randomMobileUserAgent

  • randomMobileUserAgent(): any

  • Returns random mobile user agent from the list.

    randomMobileUserAgent() // 'Mozilla/5.0 (Android; Mobile; rv:50.0) Gecko/50.0 Firefox/50.0'

    Returns any

Const rangeToArray

  • rangeToArray(__namedParameters: object): any[]

  • Creates numeric array from Range object.

    rangeToArray({ min: 1, max: 5 }) // [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]

    Parameters

    • __namedParameters: object

    Returns any[]

Const replaceHtmlEntities

  • replaceHtmlEntities(html: string): string

  • Replaces character entities in HTML document with corresponding characters.

    replaceHtmlEntities('foo&#x2F;bar') // 'foo/bar'

    Parameters

    • html: string

    Returns string

Const round

  • round(x: number, digits?: number): number

  • Rounds input number to the specified number of digits after the decimal point.

    round(1.06, 1) // 1.1
round(1.06) // 1

    Parameters

    • x: number
    • Default value digits: number = 0

    Returns number

toRange

  • toRange(min: number, max?: number): object | object

  • Creates a Range object from input values.

    If both input values are null or undefined, returns undefined.

    toRange(1, 5) // { min: 1, max: 5 }
toRange(1) // { min: 1, max: 1 }
toRange(1, null) // { min: 1 }

    Parameters

    • min: number
    • Default value max: number = min

    Returns object | object

Const valueToArray

  • valueToArray(value: T): T[]

  • Puts input value in array.

    valueToArray('foo') // ['foo']

    Parameters

    • value: T

    Returns T[]

Const yearFromTitle

  • yearFromTitle(title: string): number

  • Extracts year from string.

    Year should be in range from 1900 to 2099.

    yearFromTitle('1983 DeLorean DMC-12') // 1983

    Parameters

    • title: string

    Returns number

Const yearsArrayToRegExp

  • yearsArrayToRegExp(years: number[]): RegExp

  • Creates a regular expression from the array of years

    yearsArrayToRegExp([1999, 2000, 2001]) // '/(^|[^\w$])(1999|2000|2001|99|00|01)($|[^\w$])/i'

    Parameters

    • years: number[]

    Returns RegExp
